intro: Calycadenia tenella, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, linear leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Calycadenia tenella is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to arid environments.
